meaningMnemonic: This word uses <kanji>white</kanji> and <kanji>person</kanji> ... put those together and you have a <vocabulary>white person</vocabulary>, aka a <vocabulary>caucasian</vocabulary> person.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since 人 has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Imagine a <vocabulary>white person</vocabulary> you know well wearing their favorite pair of <reading>hack</reading>ed up <reading>jean</reading>s (はくじん). This person likes to wear jeans with as many rips and holes in them as possible. Now imagine them wearing only their hacked up jeans. What a sight!
